WorkItem.ClosedComment: fixed, user had an item that doesn't translate its data from wowhead or armory
WorkItem.Description:
When I pull up my NE warrior Sekhmeet, the values for tanking are all off. I have checked Armory, and they are translating correctly there, so I'm not sure why the values are off.
 
(Rawr) Correct Value
Armor: (24855) 23644
Defense: (531) 544
Dodge% (19.38) 20.15
 
 
And so on. Is there any fix for this?

Comments.Message:
RTM

Black Heart Armor value is being averaged out and added
You are probably missing socket bonuses or an enchant that gives defense
Set the target level on the options panel to 80 and those numbers will line up more closely. The numbers change due to target level based on the DR formula

The values above did not change when I changed the target level or added in the sockets.  I am missing no enchants, but yet Rawr still shows the values as incorrect.  When I try to run the optimize or upgrade tool this is an issue because Rawr thinks I am under my Def cap, which I am not.

Found it:
It's your Corroded Faceguard 'of the Champion'. Rawr doesn't see the 'of the Champion' part cuz it's a generic item. You'll have to edit it and add the missing stats (namely your missing 66 defense rating that your version of the item gives)
You are a god, thank you sir.
